snippet.title: Australian Tia-Clair Toomey wins 2017 CrossFit Games to be crowned fittest woman on earth
snippet.content:
Australian Tia-Clair Toomey wins the 2017 CrossFit Games.
Staff writers
Share
AUSTRALIAN Tia-Clair Toomey has won the CrossFit Games at her third attempt to be declared the fittest woman on earth. The 24-year-old Queensland's emotional victory in Madison, Wisconsin came after she finished runner-up in 2015 and 2016. Toomey, also a weightlifter who , finished the gruelling four-day event on 994 points to sneak home ahead of compatriot Kara Webb. Annie Thorisdottir of Iceland was third. Is winning the better than making it to the Olympics? "Ten times better. Like 100 times better." - ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡º The CrossFit Games, regarded as one of the toughest sporting events on the planet, test competitors' strength, speed and endurance in a. Defending champion Matt Fraser of the US retained the men's title with the most dominant performance in the event's history. MORE TO COME Originally published as
